title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Programs (NDAA-funded): Energy Projects.

description.narrative: TFBSO Energy Projects - Pipeline replacement. Implementing Partner: U.S. Government - Department of Defense. TFBSO works in partnership with the Afghan government to accelerate the development of the hydrocarbon sector, thereby increasing domestic oil and natural gas production. This not only provides the Afghan government with much-needed revenue, but also attracts private investors to business opportunities driven by the availability of these fuels. Although a nascent natural gas and oil sector is developing, billions of dollars of hydrocarbon resources remain undeveloped, jeopardizing energy security as Afghanistan continues to be dependent on imported fuels and electricity.

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Programs (NDAA-funded): Private Sector Investment.

description.narrative: TFBSO Private Sector Investment - McKinsey report printing and shipping. Implementing Partner: McKinsey & Company, Inc.. TFBSO promotes business growth and entrepreneurship by providing business management consulting to small- and medium-sized enterprises and conducting due diligence on Afghan companies to develop a pipeline for potential investors. TFBSO experts in financial analysis, accounting, business strategy, operations management, and engineering provide business management consulting and introduce firms to potential global investment partners. Working closely with international financial institutions and private investment fund managers, the Investment Team surveys the business landscape of Afghanistan for investors and helps facilitate commercial deals.

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Support (OCO-funded): Communications Support Services.

description.narrative: TFBSO Communications Support Services - Microsoft SharePoint migration. Implementing Partner: U.S. Government - Department of Defense. TFBSO supports the development of Afghanistans communications sector. Communications is one of the most successful industries in the nation. Afghanistan has increased mobile subscribers by 300 times since 2001, and facilitated $1.2 billion of investments in the telecommunications sector. Four major service providers cover over 75% of the Afghanistan population, including rural villages and urban populations alike.

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Support (OCO-funded): Life Support and Security Support Services.

description.narrative: TFBSO Life Support and Security Support Services - Contract support (El Villa). Implementing Partner: ERSM (Afghanistan) Limited. The Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) was formed by the U.S. Department of Defense to leverage American international economic power as a strategic tool for promoting economic stabilization and security. TFBSO creates opportunities for Afghanistan and works with global private sector firms as the nation rebuilds its economy, infrastructure and government.

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Programs (NDAA-funded): Minerals Projects.

description.narrative: TFBSO Minerals Projects - Natural resource SMEs (GTW extension). Implementing Partner: GTW Consultants & Associates, LLC. TFBSO works with the Afghanistan Ministry of Mines (MoM), United States Geological Survey (USGS), Afghanistan Geological Survey (AGS), and private-sector geologists to help Afghanistan develop its mining industry in a socially, environmentally and fiscally responsible way and to attract international mining companies to invest in Afghanistan. Minerals are a key resource for Afghanistans economic development. They generate significant revenue and create a large numbers of jobs in exploration, extraction, processing, and other supporting industries such as construction, power, and logistics. Accelerating development of these resources could create more than $2 billion in annual royalty and tax revenues for the Afghan government.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Programs (NDAA-funded): Indigenous Industries Projects.

description.narrative: TFBSO Indigenous Industries Projects - Agriculture/Agribusiness small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) assistance. Implementing Partner: GTW Consultants & Associates, LLC. TFBSO helps to revitalize traditional Afghan industries, such as hand-knotted carpet weaving, food processing, cashmere production, and artisan products to reintroduce these high-value goods to the international market. These sectors represent Afghanistans largest exports and hundreds of thousands of jobs across Afghanistan, in both urban and rural areas. TFBSO works closely with Afghan businesses to bring their products to international standards and facilitates access to international buyers. Renewing traditional Afghan industries and connecting the best of Afghanistans agricultural and artisan products to the global marketplace results in new jobs, increased revenue and raises Afghanistans international business profile as a country of great natural and human resources.

description.narrative: TFBSO Private Sector Investment - Herat support. Implementing Partner: Muscogee Nation Business Enterprise. TFBSO promotes business growth and entrepreneurship by providing business management consulting to small- and medium-sized enterprises and conducting due diligence on Afghan companies to develop a pipeline for potential investors. TFBSO experts in financial analysis, accounting, business strategy, operations management, and engineering provide business management consulting and introduce firms to potential global investment partners. Working closely with international financial institutions and private investment fund managers, the Investment Team surveys the business landscape of Afghanistan for investors and helps facilitate commercial deals.

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Programs (NDAA-funded): Indigenous Industries Projects.

description.narrative: TFBSO Indigenous Industries Projects - Mazar industrial site prep. Implementing Partner: Yasmin ARA, LLC. TFBSO helps to revitalize traditional Afghan industries, such as hand-knotted carpet weaving, food processing, cashmere production, and artisan products to reintroduce these high-value goods to the international market. These sectors represent Afghanistans largest exports and hundreds of thousands of jobs across Afghanistan, in both urban and rural areas. TFBSO works closely with Afghan businesses to bring their products to international standards and facilitates access to international buyers. Renewing traditional Afghan industries and connecting the best of Afghanistans agricultural and artisan products to the global marketplace results in new jobs, increased revenue and raises Afghanistans international business profile as a country of great natural and human resources.

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Programs (NDAA-funded): Minerals Projects.

description.narrative: TFBSO Minerals Projects - Helo support. Implementing Partner: Vertical de Aviacion SAS. TFBSO works with the Afghanistan Ministry of Mines (MoM), United States Geological Survey (USGS), Afghanistan Geological Survey (AGS), and private-sector geologists to help Afghanistan develop its mining industry in a socially, environmentally and fiscally responsible way and to attract international mining companies to invest in Afghanistan. Minerals are a key resource for Afghanistans economic development. They generate significant revenue and create a large numbers of jobs in exploration, extraction, processing, and other supporting industries such as construction, power, and logistics. Accelerating development of these resources could create more than $2 billion in annual royalty and tax revenues for the Afghan government.

TFBSO works in partnership with the Afghan government to accelerate the development of the hydrocarbon sector, thereby increasing domestic oil and natural gas production.
